intro: Stibasia douglasii, commonly known as Douglas's stibaria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces a distinctive, globular fruit that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
